content.question:
<math alttext="H 2 O liquid plus H 2 O liquid is in equilibrium with H 3 O with a positive 1 charge aqueous plus O H with a negative 1 charge aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O(</mtext><mi>l</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O(</mtext><mi>l</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>⇄</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
At <math alttext="5.0 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.0</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, the value of <math alttext="K sub w" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>w</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> for the equilibrium shown above is <math alttext="1.9 times 10 to the negative 15 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.9</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>15</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and the value of <math alttext="p K sub w" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>w</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is 14.73. Based on this information, which of the following is correct for pure water at this temperature?

choices.label: <math alttext="the molar concentration of H 3 O with a positive 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></math> <math alttext="equals the square root of 1.9 times 10 to the negative 15 power, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>1.9</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>15</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="p H equals the negative log of 1.9 times 10 to the negative 15 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mtext>log(1.9</mtext><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>15</mn></mrow></msup><mtext>)</mtext><mo>⁢</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="14.73 equals the equilibrium molar concentration of H 3 O with a positive 1 charge times the equilibrium molar concentration of O H with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>14.73</mn><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="p O H equals p H plus 14.73" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pOH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>14.73</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the molar concentration of H 3 O with a positive 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></math> <math alttext="equals the square root of 1.9 times 10 to the negative 15 power, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>1.9</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>15</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
